meanings.definition: The position or job of a clerk.
meanings.sent1: In the store, many people apply for clerkships to help customers.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed her clerkships at the library, organizing books and assisting visitors.
meanings.sent3: The clerkships at the bakery involved a lot of frosting mishaps.
meanings.sent4: His clerkships in the office were like being a puzzle piece in a big picture.
meanings.sent5: During the clerkships, he learned the importance of organization and attention to detail.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which a person serves as a clerk.
meanings.sent1: Her clerkships at the law firm lasted for six months.
meanings.sent2: During his clerkships, he gained valuable experience in customer service.
meanings.sent3: The clerkships seemed to fly by in a blur of paperwork and phone calls.
meanings.sent4: The clerkships felt like a journey through the world of office procedures.
meanings.sent5: In his clerkships, he met many interesting people and learned new skills.

meanings.definition: The duties or responsibilities of a clerk.
meanings.sent1: His clerkships included filing documents and answering phone calls.
meanings.sent2: She took on extra clerkships to help with the busy workload.
meanings.sent3: The clerkships required a lot of multitasking and attention to detail.
meanings.sent4: In her clerkships, she felt like the backbone of the team, keeping things running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: During the clerkships, he learned the importance of customer satisfaction and accuracy.
